title: Why are there so many people who enjoy listening to the same songs over and over again?
self_text: I have listened to a lot of songs over and over again, but if someone is listening to the same song for hours on end, what's their motivation? Do they just not have anything else to do?  I don't know how to answer this question because it seems like an odd request, but I feel like if someone enjoys something that much, then they should be able to listen to it as much as they want.

title: Why do some people like to be rude and disrespectful?
self_text: Just don't get it, why would someone want to make other people feel bad?

title: Do people think that if you're wearing a mask and have a beard, you're less likely to be recognized?
self_text: I've been thinking about it lately, and I wonder if there's any truth to the idea that people are more likely to recognize faces than they are masks or beards.

title: Is it safe to get a tattoo of my son on my arm?
self_text: He's 3 now, and I want to do something to show him how much I love him when he gets older. My wife doesn't like the idea but she has made no effort to talk about it or put me off from doing it. I want to give him an option to decide if he wants to do it as well. But am I making things more complicated?

title: How to get rid of a stain on my pants?
self_text: I spilled some wine on my favorite jeans and the stain won’t come out. What should I do?

title: Is it ever okay to give up on a relationship?
self_text: I've been with my girlfriend for about 4 years now, and we have a really good connection. We love each other but there are things that make me nervous about the future of our relationship. She has her own life, friends, hobbies, and goals and I love being able to support them. But sometimes she is not supportive or doesn't understand me when I try to be supportive to her. It's like if I can't do something for her I get upset, which I know isn't fair. This happens so often that I feel like I am constantly giving without getting anything back. So many times she won't even remember what I did for her last week. And sometimes I find myself wanting to talk to her about my feelings and problems but she just shuts me down or changes the subject. Lately I'm finding myself feeling empty after talking to her. Maybe I'm overthinking things, maybe I'm not seeing the big picture. I don't want to ruin things between us, I really don't. I just want to know if it's worth trying to fix these issues or if I should start thinking about moving on. Is there any way to tell if someone is truly invested in a relationship or not?  I'd appreciate your thoughts or experiences

title: Why do people get so angry when people tell them that they are wrong about something?
self_text: I am an idiot, but if someone says something is wrong and then explains it to me, I will listen to them and admit that I was wrong. However, some people seem to take it personally, like I have done something to offend them. I do not mean to offend anyone, so why do they react the way that they do?

title: Why do people think that if a man is not wearing underwear, it's considered rude to look at him?
self_text: I can see why you would say that, but when I was younger, my mom used to tell me not to stare at men in the gym who don't have underwear on. It feels like it’s rude and makes them feel uncomfortable. Is it because they are vulnerable or just awkward to see?

title: Why do people put a little bit of butter on their cereal?
self_text: It's disgusting and I can't understand it.  It makes the cereal soggy and tastes terrible. Is there any reason why they do that?

title: Do you think that if you have a bad dream and then wake up, the next time you go to sleep you will also have a bad dream?
self_text: I dont want to be thinking about it all night, but I keep having bad dreams for no reason at all so I am wondering if its just my brain overthinking it.

title: Why does it feel like everything is a scam?
self_text: Like, I'm not saying that EVERYTHING is a scam but it feels like most things are just people trying to take advantage of you. Even stuff that isn't obviously bad. For example, I bought a brand new phone last year and it died after a year. The company gave me a replacement but the replacement also died after only 6 months. Now I think they just wanted my money for free. Or when you buy something online and the shipping cost is so high! Is there anything that can be done about it? Or am I just too cynical?

title: Does anyone else find that the way they ask questions on the news is wrong?
self_text: Is it just me or are people asking these questions in a weird way? For example, like when you see them asking something like “What do you think about the war in Ukraine?” Or something similar. It’s not wrong to ask, but it feels like they're doing it for show more than anything, and they don't actually want an answer. Like if they really wanted an answer, they would be asking something more direct. What do you guys think?

title: Why do people get confused about the way to spell the word "ball" ?

If somebody is using your name for something like an advertisement or anything, then thats probably fine, but if you're saying you're going to call someone something and they get mad about it, thats weird, right?

He said that it's just programming based on data sets. How would you guys explain this to someone who doesn't know much about computers or AI?  I think it’s annoying because it sounds like an insult to all the scientists working on it, but I wanted to know if his reaction makes sense from a technical perspective.   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xy3wV8Y7k-c

title: How does a union deal with a business that doesn’t want to pay overtime?
self_text: My friend works for a local grocery store, and they are constantly understaffed during peak hours. The manager has been telling him that he is getting paid overtime when he isn't, but it seems like the business keeps giving them time off instead of paying them overtime. They have told me that their main reason for not paying them overtime is because they don’t want to pay out more money than they have to.   Is there any way to resolve this issue, or should my friend just quit his job?  I can see why the company might be trying to save money by not paying overtime, but my friend feels like it’s wrong, and I agree. Is there anything else he can do to try to get his employer to comply with the labor laws?

title: Does the US government take over all of my taxes?
self_text: I have a question that has been plaguing me for years, and I need to know what your opinion is on it. I’ve always known that the US government takes a lot of taxes from people. But I want to know how much of those taxes actually goes towards things like defense, roads, or other services.  I have heard arguments about the fact that most taxes go toward social security and medicare, but are they really?   I am curious as to whether the United States government is actually taking over all of my money, or if there is any left over to improve our country.

title: Why are the names of the things that get you banned from places so specific?
self_text: I was walking in a mall, and I saw someone get kicked out because he was using a backpack to hide his phone (which is against their rules) but the sign just said “No Backpacks” not “no large bags.” I’m just wondering if they have more specific rules than what people know about or if it's just something they do for extra security.

title: Why do some people have a hard time sleeping and others don't?
self_text: I was just reading about sleep disorders, and it seems that the most common thing is insomnia. I’ve had trouble falling asleep for years, but my brother has never had an issue with sleep. How does that happen?

title: Why do some people use a lot of words to say simple things and others say very little?
self_text: I’ve been noticing lately that people seem to over-explain everything they say. They will say something like, “I am going to go get the water from the fridge.” Instead of just saying, “I’m getting water.” Is this common? Or is it just me?

I want to try cleaning my old couch first so I can see how well the new couch cleans up.  I don't know what type of material the new couch is made out of. It's super soft, but not like velvet or anything. Is there any product I should use to clean the stains off? Thanks for your help!

title: Why does it feel like everyone is judging my life choices?

It could be as simple as buying a coffee or eating a burger, but it still feels like there's an audience watching me and passing judgment.  I don't have any real reason to think that's the case, but that's how it feels. Is this normal? What can I do about it?

title: Is it possible to have a bad dream and still be able to wake up?

It was weirdly peaceful, it's weird I can't even recall what happened. I'm wondering if there's any way to trigger that feeling so I could get to sleep and feel like that?

title: Is it possible to get a medical marijuana card in California?
self_text: I live in San Diego, and my friend has a medical marijuana card. It's an easy process to obtain one if you have a medical condition. However, I've been researching the process more, and the requirements are pretty strict.  It seems that there is no way to get a card through the state of california. Only certain doctors can prescribe it, which limits who gets access. Also, many insurance companies won't cover the cost of getting a card, and some don't even allow their patients to be covered by the plan, so they end up paying out-of-pocket for the entire thing.   I am considering going into the doctor and asking about obtaining one, but I also want to see what other options might be available.   The requirements are: - Must have a qualifying medical condition - Must have a doctor who will write you a recommendation (not a prescription) - Must provide proof of residency - Must pay a fee ($100)   Also, many people in California use the "smoker's license" or "medical marijuana registry" as a way to gain access to the product without having a medical marijuana card. I don't know how legal that is.   I just wanted to ask the community if anyone had any experience with this, and if it was worth it.

title: Why do some people always take the long way around?
self_text: It's really annoying when I'm in a rush and someone is going the same direction, but taking the long route. Like if you're going from point A to B, just go straight to B, don't take all these roads that aren't needed. What's the deal?

title: Why do people use “cops” in the context of a bad situation?
self_text: I am referring to when someone is saying that they are going to call cops and arrest someone, or say that it’s like police brutality. I just don't understand why we would use this term for something so serious.

title: What is the best way to clean a car's interior?

title: Why are some people able to take a lot of shit from others and not feel bad, while other people get really hurt by it?

Also how does that happen with things like taking advantage of someone's trust or saying something hurtful?

title: Why do people still smoke cigarettes?
self_text: It's bad for you, expensive and smells awful, so why are some people still doing it?

title: Is it a crime to make up facts in an argument?
self_text: I was arguing with my girlfriend and I said that the moon is made of cheese. She laughed at me but then asked me how i knew that. And I responded by saying that I read it on wikipedia. But then she responded by saying that Wikipedia isn't always correct.  I had to go back and find the article about the moon, and sure enough there was a sentence that said "the Moon is believed to have been formed from debris created by a giant impact between Earth and a Mars-sized object".   So now I am wondering if what I did was wrong or not.

title: Does anyone else think that the way that a lot of people talk about how they're 'living their best life' and are so happy is just a facade?
self_text: I know it's probably too much, but I can't shake this feeling. So many people online seem to have perfect lives. It's like they've got everything figured out and are so content with their lives. And when you look at them, there seems to be an almost desperate need to show everyone how good their life is.  It makes me feel pretty bad for myself because I don't see any of those things in my own life. I guess I don't want to sound like I'm complaining or anything, but I just wanted to get some other peoples thoughts on it.

title: Is it possible to be a bad person without being evil?
self_text: If I make a decision that is harmful to others, but not malicious, and not cruel or sad, am I still a bad person? Like if you accidentally run someone over in the street, you are a bad person for doing so, but if you did it with no malice and didn't even realize you were running them over until after the fact, are you still considered a bad person? And can you be considered a bad person when you have an idea and decide to act on it, but do not intend any harm to anyone?

title: Why do people give a damn about the weather?
self_text: I’m just not sure why everyone seems so worried about it. I mean, there's nothing we can do to stop it from being bad. If it's hot then what do you do? If it's cold then what do you do?  It seems like such an overreaction and most of them seem really annoying when they are talking about the weather. I don’t know. Maybe I am wrong.

title: Why do I have to pay for a bottle of water when I buy an alcoholic drink?

title: Why do some people have such bad luck?
self_text: I'm not talking about a small thing like spilling coffee or missing the bus. I mean things that are completely out of their control, and it keeps happening to them. Like, I saw someone get hit by a car yesterday while they were crossing the street in the middle of the day, and there was nothing wrong with them. Or another person got fired from his job because of something he didn't even do.   I don't know if it is just my perception of reality, but sometimes it feels like some people are cursed.  And I've had so much bad luck myself. It's hard for me to cope with life when I feel like everything is going wrong. Is it possible that some people are unlucky just because of how they are built? Or should we just learn to accept it and move on?   What makes you think some people are more lucky than others?  I am just curious to know what other people think.

title: Is it possible to be a bad person for not being a good person?
self_text: I am an extremely nice and caring person, but I sometimes find myself annoyed by people who are the opposite. I'm talking about people that aren't always kind or thoughtful of others, maybe they are rude, condescending, or just generally unpleasant to talk to.  I don't hate them, and I try to understand where they come from, but I can't help feeling like their behavior is wrong. Should I worry that I have some sort of moral defect, or is it normal to dislike people who are unkind? Also, how do you deal with someone who treats you badly without letting it affect your own emotions?   It might sound weird, but I feel like there’s something wrong with me because I get irritated when people treat me poorly. It’s not that I want them to change, more so that I think it’s wrong of them to act that way toward me. Does it make sense what I’m saying? Do you know anyone else who feels like this?

title: How to get over the feeling of being judged and judged by everyone around me?
self_text: I was never bullied, but I always felt like everyone was judging my decisions based on my opinions. If I say something that someone disagrees with, they think it's stupid or wrong. Or if I am not doing something they are, they judge me for it. I can't seem to be able to ignore these thoughts, and it makes me avoid talking about what I want to talk about in order to avoid any judgement. Is there a way to get rid of this feeling?

title: Why is the US so obsessed with being a "winner" in everything?
self_text: Like, everywhere I go people are always talking about how good they are at something or that their team/company/family won something. It's like everyone wants to be first place and it's exhausting to see. I guess it makes sense because of competition but why does it have to be that competitive? Is there a reason why Americans are always trying to win?

title: If you find a $20 bill on the street, do you pick it up or not?
self_text: I'm kinda lazy and don't want to go out of my way to return it but then again, it is someone else's money, so I should be honest. What would you do?

title: What would be the best way to get rid of a lot of these old, heavy metal chairs?
self_text: I have about 20 metal chairs and they are really heavy so I can’t just throw them away. Are there any services that might pick them up or would it be cheaper to sell them on Craigslist/Facebook Marketplace?

title: Why do people put the first letter of their name in uppercase?
self_text: Is it for emphasis? Or just because I can't figure out why they do it?

title: Why do people always say “don’t trust anyone” but then they are always the ones who end up breaking promises?
self_text: Is there a reason why some people think they can break promises, and others cannot?

title: Why does the world seem to be getting darker?
self_text: I’ve been feeling like it is and I don't know why. It could just be the weather, or my mood, but I feel like there are more dark places in the sky now than when I was a kid.  I guess it's just a thought that's been on my mind lately and I wanted to see if anyone else feels like this.
